member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper
member.summary: The SqlHelper class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common uses of SqlClient

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.DeriveParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)
member.summary: Calls the SqlCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters, doing any setup and cleanup necessary
member.param: The SqlCommand referencing the stored procedure from which the parameter information is to be derived. The derived parameters are added to the Parameters collection of the SqlCommand.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.GetParameter(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Get a SqlParameter for use in a SQL command
member.param: The name of the parameter to create
The value of the specified parameter
member.returns: A SqlParameter object

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.GetParameter(System.String,System.Data.DbType,System.Int32,System.Data.ParameterDirection)
member.summary: Get a SqlParameter for use in a SQL command
member.param: The name of the parameter to create
The System.Data.DbType of the parameter
The size of the parameter
The System.Data.ParameterDirection of the parameter
member.returns: A SqlParameter object

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.GetParameter(System.String,System.Data.DbType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Data.DataRowVersion)
member.summary: Get a SqlParameter for use in a SQL command
member.param: The name of the parameter to create
The System.Data.DbType of the parameter
The size of the parameter
The source column of the parameter
The System.Data.DataRowVersion of the parameter
member.returns: A SqlParameter object

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(command);
member.param: The SqlCommand to execute
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored prcedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the provided SqlConnection.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: A valid SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the specified SqlConnection using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the specified SqlConnection using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the provided SqlTransaction.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(trans, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: A valid SqlTransaction
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the specified SqlTransaction using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(trans, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid SqlTransaction
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the specified SqlTransaction using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid SqlTransaction
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteDataset(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: DataSet ds = ExecuteDataset(command);
member.param: The SqlCommand to execute
member.returns: A dataset containing the resultset generated by the command

member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: DataSet ds = ExecuteDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders");

The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: A dataset containing the resultset generated by the command

An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteScalar(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)

member.returns: An object containing the value in the 1x1 resultset generated by the command

member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified SqlTransaction using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid SqlTransaction
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: A dataset containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.FillDataset(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"});
member.param: The SqlCommand to execute
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.FillDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"});
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.FillDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[],System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"}, new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.UpdateDataset(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Executes the respective command for each inserted, updated, or deleted row in the DataSet.
member.remarks: e.g.: UpdateDataset(conn, insertCommand, deleteCommand, updateCommand, dataSet, "Order");
member.param: A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to insert new records into the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to delete records from the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure used to update records in the data source
The DataSet used to update the data source
The DataTable used to update the data source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.UpdateDataset(System.Data.IDbCommand,System.Data.IDbCommand,System.Data.IDbCommand,System.Data.DataSet,System.String,GotDotNet.ApplicationBlocks.Data.AdoHelper.RowUpdatingHandler,GotDotNet.ApplicationBlocks.Data.AdoHelper.RowUpdatedHandler)
member.summary: Executes the System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand for each inserted, updated, or deleted row in the DataSet also implementing RowUpdating and RowUpdated Event Handlers
member.param: A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to insert new records into the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to delete records from the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure used to update records in the data source
The DataSet used to update the data source
The DataTable used to update the data source.
The AdoHelper.RowUpdatingEventHandler or null
The AdoHelper.RowUpdatedEventHandler or null

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.CreateCommand(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Simplify the creation of a Sql command object by allowing a stored procedure and optional parameters to be provided
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlCommand command = CreateCommand(connenctionString, "AddCustomer", "CustomerID", "CustomerName");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored procedure
An array of string to be assigned as the source columns of the stored procedure parameters
member.returns: A valid SqlCommand object

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.CreateCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Simplify the creation of a Sql command object by allowing a stored procedure and optional parameters to be provided
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlCommand command = CreateCommand(conn, "AddCustomer", "CustomerID", "CustomerName");
member.param: A valid SqlConnection object
The name of the stored procedure
An array of string to be assigned as the source columns of the stored procedure parameters
member.returns: A valid SqlCommand object

member.summary: Simplify the creation of a Sql command object by allowing a stored procedure and optional parameters to be provided

A valid SQL string to execute
The CommandType to execute (i.e. StoredProcedure, Text)
The SqlParameters to pass to the command
member.returns: A valid SqlCommand object

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQueryTypedParams(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the dataRow column values as the stored procedure's parameters values. This method will assign the parameter values based on row values.
member.param: The SqlCommand to execute
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQueryTypedParams(System.String,System.String,System.Data.DataRow)

member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection

The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache
member.summary: SqlHelperParameterCache provides functions to leverage a static cache of procedure parameters, and the ability to discover parameters for stored procedures at run-time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache.CacheParameterSet(System.String,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Add parameter array to the cache
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters to be cached

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache.GetCachedParameterSet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a parameter array from the cache
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An array of SqlParamters

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache.GetSpParameterSet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the set of SqlParameters appropriate for the stored procedure
member.remarks: This method will query the database for this information, and then store it in a cache for future requests.
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored procedure
member.returns: An array of SqlParameters

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache.GetSpParameterSet(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the set of SqlParameters appropriate for the stored procedure
member.remarks: This method will query the database for this information, and then store it in a cache for future requests.
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored procedure
A bool value indicating whether the return value parameter should be included in the results
member.returns: An array of SqlParameters

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache.GetSpParameterSet(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the set of SqlParameters appropriate for the stored procedure
member.remarks: This method will query the database for this information, and then store it in a cache for future requests.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection object
The name of the stored procedure
member.returns: An array of SqlParameters

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.Data.SqlHelperParameterCache.GetSpParameterSet(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the set of SqlParameters appropriate for the stored procedure
member.remarks: This method will query the database for this information, and then store it in a cache for future requests.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection object
The name of the stored procedure
A bool value indicating whether the return value parameter should be included in the results
member.returns: An array of SqlParameters
